p: This page explains what needs to be done to migrate the SML from the old BRZ operated domain to the new DG DIGIT operated domain. This document tries to explain the requirements in a general manner but will focus on the CIPA e-Delivery implementation for the technical details.
The changes in the SML affect the following components:

ul.li: SMP server - the server/backend component of the SMP
SMP client - the client/requesting component of the SMP
AP server - the receiving component of the Access Point (because SMP client usage)
AP client - the sending component of the Access Point (because SMP client usage)

div: Note: inside this document the term SML represents the production SML and the term SMK represents the publically available test version of the SML which should not be used in production.

This is the SMP server component that manages all endpoints and has a connection to the SML for creating, updating and deleting entries in the DNS system. The difference between the two applications is only that cipa-smp-full-webapp supports reading and writing REST API, whereas cipa-smp-readonly-webapp supports only the reading REST API. This differentiation exists because the SMP specification only specifies the reading access.
